benchmark_details.name: MapQA
benchmark_details.overview: MapQA is a novel dataset that provides question-answer pairs and includes the geometries of geo-entities referenced in the questions, addressing the limitations of existing geospatial QA datasets. It consists of 3,154 QA pairs across nine geospatial question types requiring reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance research on geospatial question answering by providing a comprehensive dataset and evaluating methods tailored for the MapQA problem setting.

data.annotation: Heuristic labeling functions crafted by domain experts.

methods: Text-to-SQL generation using Large Language Models
methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the correctness of generated answers matching ground-truth data.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in answering geospatial question types.
methodology.baseline_results: Benchmarked against existing retrieval models and LLMs.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using two regions (Southern California and Illinois) with performance compared across different question types.
